(intIssueWidth, power_logic).explanation: Increasing integer issue width requires more complex instruction scheduling logic, dispatch units, and execution control circuits, directly increasing the power consumption of logic components;

(intIssueWidth, power_leakage).explanation: Wider issue width necessitates more transistors in execution units, register files, and control logic, leading to increased static leakage power consumption;

(intIssueWidth, area_cell_area).explanation: Higher integer issue width requires additional execution units, larger register files, and more complex scheduling hardware, directly increasing the total cell area of the processor;
